item.title: Ellen add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Making money isn't hard in itself... What's hard is to earn it doing something worth devoting one's life to." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Ellen add a quote by E. L. Doctorow
item.description: "I am often asked the question How can the masses permit themselves to be exploited by the few. The answer is By being persuaded to identify with them. Carrying his newspaper with your picture the laborer goes home to his wife, an exhausted workhorse with veins standing out in her legs, and he dreams not of justice but of being rich." -- E. L. Doctorow

item.title: Ellen add a quote by Diana Abu-Jaber
item.description: "...tasting a piece of bread that someone bought is like looking at that person, but tasting a piece of bread that they baked is like looking out of their eyes." -- Diana Abu-Jaber
